a.title: Follow this site and get back to it easily from your sites page.

br.div:
Merced County school districts have suspended in-class instruction for the remainder of the 2019-20 school year and transitioned to distance learning. Click on the links below for information and resources.
Los distritos escolares del condado de Merced han suspendido la instrucción en clase durante el resto del año escolar 2019-20 y han pasado a la educación a distancia. Haga clic en los enlaces a continuación para obtener información y recursos.​ ​COVID-1​​9 County Resources​​​​

li.a: Vocabulary Development In Early Education Instruction

span.title: Title IX - Allows authors to enter rich text content.

div.div:
​
Title IX Laws - Discrimination and Harassment​
The Merced County Office of Education is committed to providing educational programs, activities and services that are free from unlawful discrimination based on actual or perceived legally protected characteristics, or association with a person or group with one or more of such characteristics, including sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, and gender expression, as required by Title IX of the Education Amendments of 1972. If you believe you have been subjected to unlawful discrimination, harassment, intimidation, or bullying you should contact your principal/coordinator and/or the County Office Title IX Coordinator, Eva. L. Chavez. A copy of the MCOE Uniform Complaint policy PDF Download and Nondiscrimination in Employment policy PDF Download are available here and upon request. The requirement not to discriminate in the education program or activity extends to employment.
